 494+ C849 01 22 00     UnivInitRuntime:        ld      bc,UBnkRuntimeSize
 495+ C84C 21 40 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkStartOfRuntimeData
 496+ C84F                                      ZeroA
 496+ C84F AF          >                        xor a
 497+ C850 32 5A C0                             ld      (UBnkECMCountDown),a
 498+ C853 77           .InitLoop:              ld      (hl),a
 499+ C854 23                                   inc     hl
 500+ C855 10 FC                                djnz    .InitLoop
 501+ C857              .SetEnergy:             ldCopyByte EnergyAddr, UBnkEnergy
 501+ C857 3A 06 C4    >                        ld       a,(EnergyAddr)
 501+ C85A 32 59 C0    >                        ld       (UBnkEnergy),a
 502+ C85D FD 7C        .SetBankData:           ld      a,iyh
 503+ C85F 32 40 C0                             ld      (UBnkSlotNumber),a
 504+ C862 C6 46                                add     a,BankUNIVDATA0
 505+ C864 32 41 C0                             ld      (UBnkShipUnivBankNbr),a
 506+ C867 FD 7D                                ld      a,iyl
 507+ C869 32 44 C0                             ld      (UBnkShipModelId),a
 508+ C86C CD 0F E0                             call    GetShipBankId                ; this will mostly be debugging info
 509+ C86F 32 42 C0                             ld      (UBnkShipModelBank),a        ; this will mostly be debugging info
 510+ C872 78                                   ld      a,b                          ; this will mostly be debugging info
 511+ C873 32 43 C0                             ld      (UBnkShipModelNbr),a         ; this will mostly be debugging info
 512+ C876 3A 0B C4     .SetUpMissileCount:     ld      a,(LaserAddr)                ; get laser and missile details
 513+ C879 E6 0F                                and     ShipMissileCount
 514+ C87B 4F                                   ld      c,a
 515+ C87C 3A 78 7E                             ld      a,(RandomSeed1)              ; missile flag limit
 516+ C87F A1                                   and     c                            ; .
 517+ C880 32 5D C0                             ld      (UBnkMissilesLeft),a
 518+ C883 3A 0B C4     .SetupLaserType         ld      a,(LaserAddr)
 519+ C886 E6 F0                                and     ShipLaserPower
 520+ C888 ED 23                                swapnib
 521+ C88A 32 5C C0                             ld      (UBnkLaserPower),a
 522+ C88D 3A 10 C4     .SetUpFighterBays:      ld      a,(ShipAIFlagsAddr)
 523+ C890 4F                                   ld      c,a
 524+ C891 E6 70                                and     ShipFighterBaySize
 525+ C893                                      JumpIfANENusng ShipFighterBaySizeInf, .LimitedBay
 525+ C893 FE 70       >                        cp     ShipFighterBaySizeInf
 525+ C895 C2 9A C8    >                        jp      nz,.LimitedBay
 526+ C898 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF                       ; force unlimited ships
 527+ C89A ED 23        .LimitedBay:            swapnib                             ; as its bits 6 to 4 and we have removed bit 7 we can cheat with a swapnib
 528+ C89C 32 5F C0                             ld      (UBnkFightersLeft),a
 529+ C89F 79           .SetUpFighterType:      ld      a,c                         ; get back AI flags
 530+ C8A0 E6 0C                                and     ShipFighterType             ; fighter type is bits 2 and 3
 531+ C8A2 CB 1F                                rr      a                           ; so get them down to 0 and 1
 532+ C8A4 CB 1F                                rr      a                           ;
 533+ C8A6 21 45 C8                             ld      hl,FighterTypeMapping       ; then use the lookup table
 534+ C8A9 ED 31                                add     hl,a                        ; for the respective ship id
 535+ C8AB 7E                                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; we work on this for optimisation
 536+ C8AC 32 5E C0                             ld      (UBnkFighterShipId),a       ; ship data holds index to this table
 537+ C8AF 3A 11 C4     .SetUpECM:              ld      a,(ShipECMFittedChanceAddr) ; Now handle ECM
 538+ C8B2 47                                   ld      b,a
 539+ C8B3 3A 7A 7E     .FetchLatestRandom:     ld      a,(RandomSeed3)
 540+ C8B6                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .ECMFitted
 540+ C8B6 B8          >                        cp      b
 540+ C8B7 DA C2 C8    >                        jp		c, .ECMFitted
 541+ C8BA              .ECMNotFitted:          SetMemFalse UBnkECMFitted
 541+ C8BA 3E FF       >                        ld      a,$FF
 541+ C8BC 32 5B C0    >                        ld      (UBnkECMFitted),a
 542+ C8BF C3 C6 C8                             jp      .DoneECM
 543+ C8C2              .ECMFitted:             SetMemTrue  UBnkECMFitted
 543+ C8C2 AF          >                        xor     a
 543+ C8C3 32 5B C0    >                        ld      (UBnkECMFitted),a
 544+ C8C6              .DoneECM:               ; TODO set up laser power
 545+ C8C6 C9                                   ret
 546+ C8C7                  DISPLAY "Tracing 2", $
 547+ C8C7
 548+ C8C7                                      include "Universe/Ships/InitialiseOrientation.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/InitialiseOrientation.asm
   1++C8C7              ;  sidev = (1,  0,  0)  sidev = (&6000, 0, 0)
   2++C8C7              ;  roofv = (0,  1,  0)  roofv = (0, &6000, 0)
   3++C8C7              ;  nosev = (0,  0, -1)  nosev = (0, 0, &E000)   E000 = SignBit[96]
   4++C8C7              InitialiseOrientation:
   5++C8C7 21 00 00     ZI1:                    ld      hl, 0
   6++C8CA 22 2C C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatSidevY),hl                ; set the zeroes
   7++C8CD 22 2E C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatSidevZ),hl                ; set the zeroes
   8++C8D0 22 30 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatRoofvX),hl                ; set the zeroes
   9++C8D3 22 34 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatRoofvZ),hl                ; set the zeroes
  10++C8D6 22 36 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevX),hl                ; set the zeroes
  11++C8D9 22 38 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevY),hl                ; set the zeroes
  12++C8DC              ; Optimised as already have 0 in l
  13++C8DC 26 60                                ld      h, $60	             				; 96 in hi byte
  14++C8DE                                      ;ld      hl,1
  15++C8DE 22 2A C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatSidevX),hl
  16++C8E1 22 32 C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatRoofvY),hl
  17++C8E4              ; Optimised as already have 0 in l
  18++C8E4 26 E0                                ld      h, $E0					            ; -96 in hi byte which is +96 with hl bit 7 set
  19++C8E6 22 3A C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevZ),hl
  20++C8E9 C9                                   ret
  21++C8EA
  22++C8EA              InitialisePlayerMissileOrientation:
  23++C8EA CD C7 C8                             call    InitialiseOrientation
  24++C8ED 21 00 60                             ld      hl,$6000
  25++C8F0 22 3A C0                             ld      (UBnkrotmatNosevZ),hl           ; mius
  26++C8F3 C9                                   ret
  27++C8F4
  28++C8F4
  29++C8F4              ;  sidev = (1,  0,  0)  sidev = (&6000, 0, 0)
  30++C8F4              ;  roofv = (0,  1,  0)  roofv = (0, &6000, 0)
  31++C8F4              ;  nosev = (-0,  -0, 1) nosev = (0, 0, &6000)
  32++C8F4 CD C7 C8     LaunchedOrientation:    call    InitialiseOrientation
  33++C8F7                                      FlipSignMem UBnkrotmatNosevX+1;  as its 0 flipping will make no difference
  33++C8F7 3A 37 C0    >                        ld  a,(UBnkrotmatNosevX+1)
  33++C8FA EE 80       >                        xor SignOnly8Bit
  33++C8FC 32 37 C0    >                        ld  (UBnkrotmatNosevX+1),a
  34++C8FF                                      FlipSignMem UBnkrotmatNosevY+1;  as its 0 flipping will make no difference
  34++C8FF 3A 39 C0    >                        ld  a,(UBnkrotmatNosevY+1)
  34++C902 EE 80       >                        xor SignOnly8Bit
  34++C904 32 39 C0    >                        ld  (UBnkrotmatNosevY+1),a
  35++C907                                      FlipSignMem UBnkrotmatNosevZ+1
  35++C907 3A 3B C0    >                        ld  a,(UBnkrotmatNosevZ+1)
  35++C90A EE 80       >                        xor SignOnly8Bit
  35++C90C 32 3B C0    >                        ld  (UBnkrotmatNosevZ+1),a
  36++C90F C9                                   ret
  37++C910
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/InitialiseOrientation.asm
 549+ C910
 550+ C910              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 551+ C910              ;OrientateVertex:
 552+ C910              ;                      [ sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z ]   [ x ]
 553+ C910              ;  projected [x y z] = [ roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z ] . [ y ]
 554+ C910              ;                      [ nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z ]   [ z ]
 555+ C910              ;
 556+ C910
 557+ C910              ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 558+ C910              ;TransposeVertex:
 559+ C910              ;                      [ sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x ]   [ x ]
 560+ C910              ;  projected [x y z] = [ sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y ] . [ y ]
 561+ C910              ;                      [ sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z ]   [ z ]
 562+ C910              ; VectorToVertex:
 563+ C910              ;                     [ sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x ]   [ x ]   [ x ]
 564+ C910              ;  vector to vertex = [ sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y ] . [ y ] + [ y ]
 565+ C910              ;                     [ sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z ]   [ z ]   [ z ]
 566+ C910              ;INPUTS:    bhl = dividend  cde = divisor where b and c are sign bytes
 567+ C910              ;OUTPUTS:   cahl = quotient cde = divisor
 568+ C910              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 569+ C910                                      ;include "./ModelRender/EraseOldLines-EE51.asm"
 570+ C910               ; OBSOLETE                       include "./ModelRender/TrimToScreenGrad-LL118.asm"
 571+ C910                                      include "./ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm"
# file opened: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
   1++C910              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2++C910
   3++C910 00           clipDx                  DB      0           ; also XX12+2
   4++C911 00           clipDxHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   5++C912 00           clipDxHighNonABS        DB      0           ; also XX12+3
   6++C913 00           clipDy                  DB      0           ; also XX12+4
   7++C914 00           clipDyHigh              DB      0           ; also XX12+5
   8++C915 00           clipGradient            DB      0
   9++C916 00           clipDxySign             DB      0
  10++C917              varX12p3                equ     clipDxySign
  11++C917 00           clipXGTY                DB      0
  12++C918 00           clipFlags               DB      0
  13++C919 00           SWAP                    DB      0
  14++C91A 00 00        varYX                   DW      0
  15++C91C              ;varRegX                 DB      0
  16++C91C              ;varXX12p2               DB      0
  17++C91C 00           clipXX13                 DB      0
  18++C91D 00           Gradient                DB      0
  19++C91E              ; for start and end y. bit7 of lower determines its not been setup yet
  20++C91E
  21++C91E              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  22++C91E                      IFNDEF       CLIPVersion3
  23++C91E ED 4B A9 C0  ClipLine:               ld      bc,(UBnkPreClipY1)          ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
  24++C922 DD 2A AD C0                          ld      ix,(UBnkPreClipY2)          ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
  25++C926 2A A7 C0                             ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipX1)          ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
  26++C929 ED 5B AB C0                          ld      de,(UBnkPreClipX2)          ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
  27++C92D AF                                   xor     a
  28++C92E 32 19 C9                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; SWAP = 0
  29++C931 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; A = X2Hi
  30++C932 FD 26 BF     .LL147:                 ld      iyh,$BF                     ; we need to be 191 as its 128 + another bit set from 0 to 6, we are using iyh as regX (128 will actually do)
  31++C935 DD B4                                or      ixh                         ; if (X2Hi L-OR Y2 Hi <> 0) goto LL107             -- X2Y2 off screen
  32++C937 20 0A                                jr      nz, .LL107
  33++C939 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  34++C93B ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; if screen hight < y2 lo, i.e y2 lo >127 goto LL107,
  35++C93E 20 03                                jr      nz,.LL107
  36++C940 FD 26 00                             ld      iyh, 0                      ; else iyh = regX = 0                                                                        -- X2Y2 on screen
  37++C943              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  38++C943              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  39++C943 FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  40++C945 32 1C C9                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  41++C948 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  42++C949 B0                                   or      b                           ;
  43++C94A 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  44++C94C 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  45++C94D ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  46++C950 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  47++C952              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  48++C952 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  49++C954 FE 00                                cp      0
  50++C956 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  51++C958              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  52++C958 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  53++C959 32 A8 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  54++C95C DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  55++C95E 32 AA C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  56++C961 7D                                   ld      a,l
  57++C962 32 A7 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  58++C965 7B                                   ld      a,e
  59++C966 32 A9 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  60++C969                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  60++C969 B7          >                        or a
  61++C96A C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  62++C96B              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  63++C96B              .PointsOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                        ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  63++C96B 37          >                        scf
  64++C96C C9                                   ret
  65++C96D FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  66++C96F B7                                   or      a
  67++C970 1F                                   rra
  68++C971 FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  69++C973 FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  70++C975 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  71++C978 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  72++C97A              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 negative
  73++C97A 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  74++C97B A2                                   and     d
  75++C97C                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  75++C97C FA 6B C9    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  76++C97F              ;                       Check for Y1 and Y2 negative
  77++C97F 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  78++C980 DD A4                                and     ixh
  79++C982                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  79++C982 FA 6B C9    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  80++C985              ;                       Check for X1 and X2 both > 255
  81++C985 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  82++C986 3D                                   dec     a
  83++C987 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  84++C989 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  85++C98A 3D                                   dec     a
  86++C98B FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  87++C98D                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  87++C98D F2 6B C9    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  88++C990              ; by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
  89++C990 DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
  90++C992 3D                                   dec     a
  91++C993 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
  92++C995 78                                   ld      a,b
  93++C996 3D                                   dec     a
  94++C997 FD B5                                or      iyl
  95++C999                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  95++C999 F2 6B C9    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
  96++C99C 79                                   ld      a,c
  97++C99D DD A5                                and     ixl
  98++C99F                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
  98++C99F FA 6B C9    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  99++C9A2              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 100++C9A2              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 101++C9A2              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 101++C9A2 B7          >                        or a
 102++C9A3 E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 103++C9A5 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 104++C9A6 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 105++C9A8 22 10 C9                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 106++C9AB 7C                                   ld      a,h
 107++C9AC 32 12 C9                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 108++C9AF              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 108++C9AF B7          >                        or a
 109++C9B0 DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 110++C9B3 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 111++C9B5 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 112++C9B7 22 13 C9                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 113++C9BA 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 114++C9BB 32 14 C9                             ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 115++C9BE              ; So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 116++C9BE 21 11 C9                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 117++C9C1 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 118++C9C2 32 84 7F                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 119++C9C5 32 16 C9                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 120++C9C8 3A 14 C9     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 121++C9CB ED 27 80                             test    $80
 122++C9CE 28 0E                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 123++C9D0 ED 5B 13 C9                          ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 124++C9D4                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 124++C9D4 AF          >					xor 	a
 124++C9D5 93          >                    sub 	e
 124++C9D6 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 124++C9D7 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 124++C9D8 92          >                    sub 	d
 124++C9D9 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 125++C9DA ED 53 13 C9                          ld      (clipDy),de                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 126++C9DE 2A 10 C9     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 127++C9E1 3A 11 C9                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 128++C9E4 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 129++C9E7 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 130++C9E9                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 131++C9E9                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 131++C9E9 AF          >					xor 	a
 131++C9EA 95          >					sub 	l
 131++C9EB 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 131++C9EC 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 131++C9ED 94          >					sub 	h
 131++C9EE 67          >					ld 		h,a
 132++C9EF              .LL111:
 133++C9EF 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 134++C9F0 B2                                   or      d
 135++C9F1 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 136++C9F3                                      ShiftDERight1
 136++C9F3 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 136++C9F5 CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 137++C9F7                                      ShiftHLRight1
 137++C9F7 CB 3C       >			   srl h
 137++C9F9 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 138++C9FB 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 139++C9FD              .CalculateDelta:
 140++C9FD              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 141++C9FD AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 142++C9FE 32 9E 7F                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 143++CA01 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 144++CA02                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 144++CA02 BB          >                        cp      e
 144++CA03 DA 13 CA    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 145++CA06              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 146++CA06 32 82 7F     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 147++CA09 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 148++CA0A 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 149++CA0B CD 8B 96                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 150++CA0E 32 83 7F                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 151++CA11 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 152++CA13              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 153++CA13 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 154++CA14 57                                   ld      d,a
 155++CA15 32 82 7F                             ld      (varQ),a
 156++CA18 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 157++CA19 CD 8B 96                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 158++CA1C 32 83 7F                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 159++CA1F 21 9E 7F                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 160++CA22 35                                   dec     (hl)
 161++CA23 D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 162++CA24 E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 163++CA25 3A 83 7F                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 164++CA28 32 15 C9                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 165++CA2B FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 166++CA2D 3A 84 7F                             ld      a,(varS)
 167++CA30 32 16 C9                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 168++CA33                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 169++CA33 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 170++CA35 FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 171++CA37 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 172++CA39 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 173++CA3C 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 174++CA3E              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 175++CA3E CD 65 CA     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 176++CA41 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 177++CA43 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 178++CA46 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 179++CA48              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 180++CA48 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 181++CA49 B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 182++CA4A C2 6B C9                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 183++CA4D B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 184++CA4E FA 6B C9                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 185++CA51              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 186++CA51              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 187++CA51 EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 188++CA52 DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 189++CA54 C5                                   push    bc
 190++CA55 DD E1                                pop     ix
 191++CA57 C1                                   pop     bc
 192++CA58 CD 65 CA                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 193++CA5B 3A 19 C9                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 194++CA5E 3D                                   dec     a
 195++CA5F 32 19 C9                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 196++CA62 C3 58 C9     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 197++CA65              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 198++CA65              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 199++CA65 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 200++CA66 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 201++CA69 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 202++CA6B 32 84 7F     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 203++CA6E E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 204++CA71 CD E7 CA                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 205++CA74                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 206++CA74                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 207++CA74 C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 208++CA77 2A 1A C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 209++CA7A 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 210++CA7B 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 211++CA7D 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 212++CA80 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 213++CA82 FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 214++CA84 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 215++CA86 3D                                   dec     a
 216++CA87 32 84 7F                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 217++CA8A E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 218++CA8D CD E7 CA                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 219++CA90                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 220++CA90                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 221++CA90 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 222++CA93 2A 1A C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 223++CA96 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 224++CA97 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 225++CA99 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 226++CA9C              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 227++CA9C 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 228++CA9D ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 229++CAA0 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 230++CAA2 32 84 7F                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 231++CAA5 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 232++CAA6 32 83 7F                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 233++CAA9 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 234++CAAC CD 48 CB                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 235++CAAF                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 236++CAAF                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 237++CAAF C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 238++CAB2 D5                                   push    de
 239++CAB3 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 240++CAB4 2A 1A C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 241++CAB7 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 242++CAB8 D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 243++CAB9 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 244++CABC 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 245++CABD E6 80                                and     $80
 246++CABF B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 247++CAC0 C8                                   ret     z
 248++CAC1 E5                                   push    hl
 249++CAC2 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 250++CAC4 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 251++CAC7 B7                                   or      a
 252++CAC8 ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 253++CACA 22 83 7F                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 254++CACD 7C                                   ld      a,h
 255++CACE E1                                   pop     hl
 256++CACF ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 257++CAD2 C0                                   ret     nz
 258++CAD3              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 259++CAD3 E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 260++CAD6 CD 48 CB                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 261++CAD9                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 262++CAD9                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 263++CAD9 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 264++CADC D5                                   push    de
 265++CADD EB                                   ex      hl,de
 266++CADE 2A 1A C9                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 267++CAE1 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 268++CAE2 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 269++CAE5 D1                                   pop     de
 270++CAE6 C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 271++CAE7                      ENDIF
 272++CAE7
 273++CAE7              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 274++CAE7              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 275++CAE7              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 276++CAE7              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 277++CAE7 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 278++CAE8 32 83 7F                             ld      (varR),a
 279++CAEB CD A5 CB                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 280++CAEE F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 281++CAEF C5                                   push    bc
 282++CAF0 47                                   ld      b,a
 283++CAF1 3A 9E 7F                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 284++CAF4 FE 00                                cp      0
 285++CAF6 78                                   ld      a,b
 286++CAF7 C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 287++CAF8 C2 0F CB                             jp      nz, .LL121
 288++CAFB              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 289++CAFB 3A 15 C9     .LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 290++CAFE 32 82 7F                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 291++CB01 CD CC 91                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 292++CB04 22 1A C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 293++CB07 F1                                   pop     af
 294++CB08 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 295++CB0B CA 3B CB                             jp      z,.LL133
 296++CB0E C9                                   ret
 297++CB0F 11 FE FF     .LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 298++CB12 2A 83 7F                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 299++CB15 3A 82 7F                             ld      a,(varQ)
 300++CB18 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 301++CB19              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 301++CB19 CB 25       >			   sla l
 301++CB1B CB 14       >			   rl  h
 302++CB1D 7C                                   ld      a,h
 303++CB1E 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 304++CB20                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 304++CB20 B8          >                        cp      b
 304++CB21 DA 2C CB    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 305++CB24 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 306++CB25 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 307++CB26 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 308++CB27 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 309++CB28 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 310++CB2A 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 311++CB2B 3F                                   ccf
 312++CB2C              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 312++CB2C CB 13       >               rl  e
 312++CB2E CB 12       >               rl  d
 313++CB30 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 314++CB32 ED 53 1A C9                          ld      (varYX),de
 315++CB36 F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 316++CB37 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 317++CB3A C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 318++CB3B 2A 1A C9     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 319++CB3E                                      NegHL
 319++CB3E AF          >                    xor a
 319++CB3F 95          >                    sub l
 319++CB40 6F          >                    ld l,a
 319++CB41 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 319++CB42 94          >                    sub h
 319++CB43 67          >                    ld h,a
 320++CB44 22 1A C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 321++CB47 C9           .LL128:                 ret
 322++CB48
 323++CB48
 324++CB48
 325++CB48
 326++CB48              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 327++CB48              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 328++CB48              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 329++CB48              ;
 330++CB48              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 331++CB48              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 332++CB48              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 333++CB48 CD A5 CB     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 334++CB4B F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 335++CB4C C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 336++CB4D 47                                   ld      b,a
 337++CB4E 3A 9E 7F                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 338++CB51 FE 00                                cp      0
 339++CB53 78                                   ld      a,b
 340++CB54 C1                                   pop     bc
 341++CB55 C2 91 CB                             jp      nz, .LL122
 342++CB58              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 343++CB58 11 FE FF     .LL121:                 ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 344++CB5B 2A 83 7F                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 345++CB5E 3A 82 7F                             ld      a,(varQ)
 346++CB61 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 347++CB62              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 347++CB62 CB 25       >			   sla l
 347++CB64 CB 14       >			   rl  h
 348++CB66 7C                                   ld      a,h
 349++CB67 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 350++CB69                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 350++CB69 B8          >                        cp      b
 350++CB6A DA 75 CB    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 351++CB6D 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 352++CB6E 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 353++CB6F 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 354++CB70 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 355++CB71 DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 356++CB73 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 357++CB74 3F                                   ccf
 358++CB75              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 358++CB75 CB 13       >               rl  e
 358++CB77 CB 12       >               rl  d
 359++CB79 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 360++CB7B ED 53 1A C9                          ld      (varYX),de
 361++CB7F F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 362++CB80 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 363++CB83 C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 364++CB84 2A 1A C9     .LL133:                 ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 365++CB87                                      NegHL
 365++CB87 AF          >                    xor a
 365++CB88 95          >                    sub l
 365++CB89 6F          >                    ld l,a
 365++CB8A 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 365++CB8B 94          >                    sub h
 365++CB8C 67          >                    ld h,a
 366++CB8D 22 1A C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 367++CB90 C9           .LL128:                 ret
 368++CB91              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 369++CB91 3A 15 C9     .LL122:                 ld      a,(clipGradient)
 370++CB94 32 82 7F                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 371++CB97 CD CC 91                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 372++CB9A 22 1A C9                             ld      (varYX),hl
 373++CB9D F1                                   pop     af
 374++CB9E ED 27 80                             test    $80
 375++CBA1 CA 84 CB                             jp      z,.LL133
 376++CBA4 C9                                   ret
 377++CBA5
 378++CBA5              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 379++CBA5              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 380++CBA5              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 381++CBA5              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 382++CBA5 3A 15 C9     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 383++CBA8 32 82 7F                             ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = XX12+2
 384++CBAB 3A 84 7F                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 385++CBAE E5 F5                                push    hl,,af                      ; else
 386++CBB0 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;   if bit 7 is clear
 387++CBB3 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127                    ;      RS = ABS RS
 388++CBB5 2A 83 7F                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ;      .
 389++CBB8                                      NegHL                               ;      .
 389++CBB8 AF          >                    xor a
 389++CBB9 95          >                    sub l
 389++CBBA 6F          >                    ld l,a
 389++CBBB 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 389++CBBC 94          >                    sub h
 389++CBBD 67          >                    ld h,a
 390++CBBE 22 83 7F                             ld      (varRS),hl                  ;      .
 391++CBC1 21 16 C9     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign              ;   hl = dxy sign
 392++CBC4 F1                                   pop     af                          ;
 393++CBC5 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 394++CBC6 E1                                   pop     hl
 395++CBC7 C9                                   ret
 396++CBC8
 397++CBC8              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 398++CBC8              ; Thow away out of bounds by more than 250
 399++CBC8              ClipLineV3:             ;break
 400++CBC8                      IFDEF       CLIPVersion3
 401++CBC8 ~            ;My logic version
 402++CBC8 ~            .CheckYorder:
 403++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipY1)
 404++CBC8 ~                                    ld      de,(UBnkPreClipY2)
 405++CBC8 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn
 406++CBC8 ~                                    jr      c,.LineP1toP2                          ; if Y1 < Y2 then we can use the points as is else we have to swap
 407++CBC8 ~            .LineP2toP1:            ld      bc,(UBnkPreClipY2)                      ; fetch and write out in reverse
 408++CBC8 ~                                    ld      ix,(UBnkPreClipY1)
 409++CBC8 ~                                    ld      de,(UBnkPreClipX1)
 410++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipX2)
 411++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipY1),bc                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 412++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipY2),ix                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 413++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipX1),hl                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 414++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipX2),de                      ;  de - XX15(4,5) X2
 415++CBC8 ~                                    jp      .CheckNoClip
 416++CBC8 ~            .LineP1toP2             ld      bc,(UBnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3) Y1
 417++CBC8 ~                                    ld      ix,(UBnkPreClipY2)                      ; ix - XX12(0,1) Y2
 418++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipX1)                      ; hl - XX15(0,1) X1
 419++CBC8 ~                                    ld      de,(UBnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5) X2
 420++CBC8 ~            .CheckNoClip:           ld      a,b
 421++CBC8 ~                                    or      d
 422++CBC8 ~                                    or      h
 423++CBC8 ~                                    or      ixh
 424++CBC8 ~                                    jp      nz,.CheckXOffScreen                 ; if both Y1 and y2 have bit 7 set
 425++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,c                                 ; then we clip
 426++CBC8 ~                                    and     ixl
 427++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80
 428++CBC8 ~                                    jp      z, .ClipComplete
 429++CBC8 ~            ;if either x1hi x2hi are 0 then we clip. if both <> 0and both same sign exit
 430++CBC8 ~            .CheckXOffScreen:       ld      a,h
 431++CBC8 ~                                    xor     d
 432++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; non descructive test of bit 7 is set
 433++CBC8 ~                                    jp      nz,.X1X2OppositeSign                ; if bit 7 was set then x1 and x2 must be opposite signs so its on screen
 434++CBC8 ~            .X1X2SameSigns:         ld      a,h                                 ; so to get there h and d must be the same sign
 435++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80                                 ; if they are the same sign and at x1 is negative then x2 must be negative so off screen
 436++CBC8 ~                                    JumpIfAIsZero .X1X2CheckIfBothRight
 437++CBC8 ~            .X1X2BothNegative:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 438++CBC8 ~                                    ret
 439++CBC8 ~            .X1X2CheckIfBothRight:  and     a                                   ; we have h in a already
 440++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.X1OnScreen
 441++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,d
 442++CBC8 ~                                    and     a
 443++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.X2OnScreen
 444++CBC8 ~            .X1X2OffRightSide:      SetCarryFlag                                ; to get to here x1 and x2 must be high and off the same sign so its not to draw
 445++CBC8 ~                                    ret
 446++CBC8 ~            ;                       to get to here x1 and x2 either span -ve to +ve or from on screen to off screen
 447++CBC8 ~            .X1OnScreen:
 448++CBC8 ~            .X2OnScreen:
 449++CBC8 ~            .X1X2OppositeSign:
 450++CBC8 ~            ;                       Now check to see if Y is off screen
 451++CBC8 ~            .CheckYOffScreen:       ld      a,b                                     ; Check if y1 and y2 are opposite signs, fi so it spans screen so we are good
 452++CBC8 ~            .CheckBothYNegative:    xor     ixh
 453++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; if bit 7 is set then opposite signs
 454++CBC8 ~                                    jp      nz,.Y1Y2OppositeSign                    ; if y1 and y2 are opposite signs its on screen and spans at least one side
 455++CBC8 ~            .Y1Y2SameSign:          ld      a,b                                     ; if they are the same sign then if one is negative, so is the other so off screen
 456++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80
 457++CBC8 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1Y2Positive
 458++CBC8 ~            .Y1Y2Negative:          SetCarryFlag
 459++CBC8 ~                                    ret
 460++CBC8 ~            .Y1Y2Positive:          ld      a,c                                     ; if its the same sign y1 or y2 could be 0 and if they are
 461++CBC8 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; this will test to see if b >0 or c > 127
 462++CBC8 ~                                    or      b                                       ;
 463++CBC8 ~                                    jp      z,.Y1OnScreen
 464++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 465++CBC8 ~                                    and     $80
 466++CBC8 ~                                    or      ixh
 467++CBC8 ~                                    jp      z,.Y2OnScreen
 468++CBC8 ~            .Y1Y2OffBottomSide:     SetCarryFlag
 469++CBC8 ~                                    ret
 470++CBC8 ~            .Y1OnScreen:
 471++CBC8 ~            .Y2OnScreen:
 472++CBC8 ~            .Y1Y2OppositeSign:
 473++CBC8 ~            .StartProcessing:       ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipX1)                      ; Now we can test and Clip
 474++CBC8 ~                                    ld      de,(UBnkPreClipX2)                      ; de - XX15(4,5)
 475++CBC8 ~                                    ld      iyh,0                                   ; set iyh flags to 0
 476++CBC8 ~            ; if x1hi or y1 high <> 0 or y1 > 127 then set bit 1 of clipcoord       ; we can optimise this later
 477++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,h
 478++CBC8 ~                                    or      b
 479++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP1Ylo
 480++CBC8 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 481++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 482++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 483++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 484++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 485++CBC8 ~            .P1OffScreen:           ld      iyh,1                                   ; if either p1 x or y was off screen set bit 0 to 1
 486++CBC8 ~                                    jp      .CheckP2OffScreen                       ; .
 487++CBC8 ~            .CheckP1Ylo:            ld      a,c                                     ; .
 488++CBC8 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 489++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2OffScreen                     ; .
 490++CBC8 ~                                    ld      iyh,1                                   ; .
 491++CBC8 ~            .CheckP2OffScreen:      ld      a,d                                     ; if x2hi or y2 off screen then set bit 2 of clipcoord to 1
 492++CBC8 ~                                    or      ixh                                     ; .
 493++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckP2Ylo                           ; .
 494++CBC8 ~            .P2OffScreen:           ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 495++CBC8 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 496++CBC8 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 497++CBC8 ~                                    jp      .CheckXDirection                        ; .
 498++CBC8 ~            .CheckP2Ylo:            ld      a,ixl                                   ; .
 499++CBC8 ~                                    and     $80                                     ; .
 500++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.CheckXDirection                      ; .
 501++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ; .
 502++CBC8 ~                                    or      2                                       ; .
 503++CBC8 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 504++CBC8 ~            .CheckXDirection:       push    de,,hl
 505++CBC8 ~                                    call    CompareHLDESgn                          ; IF HL equals DE, Z=1,C=0, IF HL is less than DE, Z=0,C=1, IF HL is more than DE, Z=0,C=0
 506++CBC8 ~                                    pop     de,,hl
 507++CBC8 ~                                    jp      c,.CalculateDx                          ;
 508++CBC8 ~            .X1gteX2:               ld      a,iyh                                   ; if x1 >= x2 then set bit 3 to denote -ve x direction, note we will eliminate horziontal / vertical early as an optimisation
 509++CBC8 ~                                    or      4                                       ; .
 510++CBC8 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ; .
 511++CBC8 ~                                    ; Y Direction is now always top to bottom
 512++CBC8 ~            .CalculateDx:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ;                       calculate DX
 513++CBC8 ~                                    sbc     hl,de                                   ; .
 514++CBC8 ~            .ABSDX:                 ld      a,h                                     ; HL = | HL - DE |
 515++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 516++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.DXPositive                           ; .
 517++CBC8 ~                                    macronegate16hl                                 ; .
 518++CBC8 ~            .DXPositive:            ex      de,hl                                   ; de = abs delta x
 519++CBC8 ~            .CalculateDy:           ClearCarryFlag                                  ; hl = Y2 -Y1 as its pre sorted its always positive if on screen
 520++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,ix                                   ; iy = hl = Y2 - Y1
 521++CBC8 ~                                    sbc     hl,bc                                   ; .
 522++CBC8 ~            .DYPositive:            ; Scale DX and DY to 8 bit, by here hl = abs dy, de = abs dx
 523++CBC8 ~            ;calculate DY
 524++CBC8 ~            .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                                     ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 525++CBC8 ~                                    or      d                                       ; .
 526++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.ScaleDone                            ; .
 527++CBC8 ~                                    ShiftDERight1                                   ; .
 528++CBC8 ~                                    ShiftHLRight1                                   ; .
 529++CBC8 ~                                    jr      .ScaleLoop                              ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been;;                                                                                               negative
 530++CBC8 ~            .ScaleDone:             ; hl = ABS DY, DE = ABS DX,  bc = Y1, ix = Y2,   note H and D will be zero
 531++CBC8 ~            ; if Dx = 0 then horizontal line and clip X1 & X2 only then exit
 532++CBC8 ~            ; if Dy = 0 then vertical line and clip Y1 & Y2 only then exit
 533++CBC8 ~
 534++CBC8 ~            ; if DX < DY  gradient = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 535++CBC8 ~            ;        else gradient = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo, set bit 5 of clipcord
 536++CBC8 ~            .CalculateDelta:        ld      a,e                                     ; if DX < DY goto DX/DY
 537++CBC8 ~                                    JumpIfALTNusng l,.DXdivDY                       ; else do DY/DX
 538++CBC8 ~            .DYdivDX:               ld      a,l                                     ;    A = DY
 539++CBC8 ~                                    ld      d,e                                     ;    D = DX
 540++CBC8 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DY / DX
 541++CBC8 ~            .SaveGradientDYDX:      ld      (Gradient),a
 542++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,iyh                                   ;    bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DX/DY (steep), if its clear its DY/DX (shallow)
 543++CBC8 ~                                    or      16                                      ;    .
 544++CBC8 ~                                    ld      iyh,a                                   ;    .
 545++CBC8 ~                                    jp      .ClipP1                                 ;    .
 546++CBC8 ~            .DXdivDY:               ld      a,e                                     ;    A = DX
 547++CBC8 ~                                    ld      d,l                                     ;    D = DY
 548++CBC8 ~                                    call    AEquAmul256DivD                         ;    A = R = 256 * DX / DY
 549++CBC8 ~            .SaveGradientDXDY:      ld      (Gradient),a
 550++CBC8 ~            ; if bit 1 of clipccord is set call    LL118
 551++CBC8 ~            .ClipP1:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; if bit 1 is clear to say no need to clip pont 1 we just jump to point 2
 552++CBC8 ~                                    test    1                                       ; .
 553++CBC8 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipP2                               ; .
 554++CBC8 ~                                    call    LL118v3                                 ; else clip P1 first
 555++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ;      and if b or h have a value its failed to totally clip  as it may be only in bounds on just x or y
 556++CBC8 ~                                    or      h                                       ;      .
 557++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z, .P1Ygt127Check                       ;      .
 558++CBC8 ~            .P1HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 559++CBC8 ~                                    ret                                             ;      .
 560++CBC8 ~            .P1Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ;      or if y > 127 its failed to totally clip
 561++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80                                     ;      .
 562++CBC8 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ;      .
 563++CBC8 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ;      .
 564++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipY1), bc                     ;      else its valid and clipped point 1 so save ti back
 565++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipX1), hl
 566++CBC8 ~            ; if bit 2 of clipcoord is set
 567++CBC8 ~            ;        swap x1y1 with x2y2
 568++CBC8 ~            ;        call    LL118
 569++CBC8 ~            .ClipP2:                ld      a,iyh                                   ; so now repeat all that for point 2
 570++CBC8 ~                                    and     2
 571++CBC8 ~                                    jp      z,.ClipComplete
 572++CBC8 ~                                    call    LL118v3PreSwap                          ; now clip p2
 573++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,b                                     ; if either high is set then it failed to properly clip
 574++CBC8 ~                                    or      h                                       ; .
 575++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z, .P2Ygt127Check                       ; .
 576++CBC8 ~            .P2HighOutofBounds:     SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 577++CBC8 ~                                    ret                                             ; .
 578++CBC8 ~            .P2Ygt127Check:         ld      a,c                                     ; if c > 127 then it also failed to clip
 579++CBC8 ~                                    test    $80                                     ; .
 580++CBC8 ~                                    SetCarryFlag                                    ; .
 581++CBC8 ~                                    ret     nz                                      ; .
 582++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipY2), bc                     ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 583++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkPreClipX2), hl
 584++CBC8 ~            ;clip compelte exit
 585++CBC8 ~            .ClipComplete:          ld      bc,(UBnkPreClipY1)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 586++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipX1)
 587++CBC8 ~                                    ld      ix,(UBnkPreClipY2)                      ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 588++CBC8 ~                                    ld      de,(UBnkPreClipX2)
 589++CBC8 ~            .SaveClippedLine:       ld      a,c                                     ; Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
 590++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
 591++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,ixl
 592++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
 593++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,l
 594++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
 595++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,e
 596++CBC8 ~                                    ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
 597++CBC8 ~                                    ClearCarryFlag                              ; we have a success so not carry
 598++CBC8 ~                                    ret
 599++CBC8 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 600++CBC8 ~            LL118v3PreSwap:         ld      bc,(UBnkPreClipY2)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 601++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipX2)
 602++CBC8 ~                                    jp      LL118v3Fetched
 603++CBC8 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 604++CBC8 ~            LL118v3:                ld      bc,(UBnkPreClipY1)                  ; bc - XX15(2,3);;
 605++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,(UBnkPreClipX1)
 606++CBC8 ~            ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 607++CBC8 ~            LL118v3Fetched:
 608++CBC8 ~            ;                       At this point bc = y position, hl = x position both 16 bit
 609++CBC8 ~            ;                       if x < 0 then x = 0
 610++CBC8 ~            ;                                     adjust = -x */ gradient depending on if its steep or shallow
 611++CBC8 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 612++CBC8 ~            ;                       if x > 255 then x = 255
 613++CBC8 ~            ;                                     adjust = x-255 */ gradient
 614++CBC8 ~            ;                                     y = y +- adjust depending on if we are going +ve direction or negative direction  (or simplify it, that it will always be + for x1y1 and - for x2y2 as we pre-sort)
 615++CBC8 ~            ;                       if y < 0 then y = 0
 616++CBC8 ~            ;                                     adjust = -y */ gradient
 617++CBC8 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 618++CBC8 ~            ;                       if y >127 then y = 127
 619++CBC8 ~            ;                                     adjust = y-127 */ gradient
 620++CBC8 ~            ;                                     x = x +- adjust depending on if we are going left to right or visa versa
 621++CBC8 ~            ;
 622++CBC8 ~            ;                       iyh     bit 0 - P1 Needs Clipping
 623++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 1 - P2 Needs Clipping
 624++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 2 - x1 >= x2 (left to right)
 625++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 3 - y1 >= y2 (top to bottom)
 626++CBC8 ~            ;                               bit 4 -  DY/DX (steep)
 627++CBC8 ~            ; if X1 hi <> 0
 628++CBC8 ~            LL118:                  ;break
 629++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,h                                     ; if x1 high is 0 then we don't need to clip x at all
 630++CBC8 ~                                    and     a
 631++CBC8 ~                                    jp      z,.X1NoClipNeeded
 632++CBC8 ~            ;                       if x1 hi bit 7 is set (so negative)
 633++CBC8 ~            .CalcBlockX:            test    $80                                     ; if h is postiive then jump to the XPositive Calc block
 634++CBC8 ~                                    jr      z,.CalcBlockXPositive
 635++CBC8 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = abs(X1) / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 636++CBC8 ~            .CalcBlockXNegative:    ld      a,iyh                                   ;
 637++CBC8 ~                                    test    16                                      ; bit 5 of iyh denotes that its a DY/DX, if its clear its DX/DY
 638++CBC8 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXNegMulGrad
 639++CBC8 ~            .CaclBlockXNegDivGrad:  macronegate16hl
 640++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 641++CBC8 ~                                    push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) / Gradient
 642++CBC8 ~                                    ld      h,c                     ; move offset into high byte of h
 643++CBC8 ~                                    ld      l,0
 644++CBC8 ~                                    ld      c,a
 645++CBC8 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 646++CBC8 ~                                    pop     bc
 647++CBC8 ~                                    jp      .DoneXNegCalc
 648++CBC8 ~            ;                       else set Adjust = abs(X1) * Gradient
 649++CBC8 ~            .CalcBlockXNegMulGrad:  push    bc                                      ; abs(X1) * Gradient
 650++CBC8 ~                                    macronegate16hl
 651++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)
 652++CBC8 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256
 653++CBC8 ~                                    pop     bc
 654++CBC8 ~            ;                       y1 += adjust * (-1 if bit 4 of clipcoord is set)
 655++CBC8 ~            ;                       x1 = 0 then call into DonrX1Calc
 656++CBC8 ~            ;                       we can skip the test for negative Y direection
 657++CBC8 ~            .DoneXNegCalc:          macronegate16hl
 658++CBC8 ~            .XNegSkipNegate:        ld      de,bc
 659++CBC8 ~                                    ex      hl,de
 660++CBC8 ~                                    add     hl,de
 661++CBC8 ~                                    ld      bc,hl
 662++CBC8 ~                                    ld      hl,0
 663++CBC8 ~                                    jp      .DoneXCalc
 664++CBC8 ~            ;                       else x1 hi is positive
 665++CBC8 ~            ;                       if clipccord bit 5 is set Adjust = X1 lo / Gradient (may need to swap bit check?)
 666++CBC8 ~            .CalcBlockXPositive:    ld      a,iyh
 667++CBC8 ~                                    test    16
 668++CBC8 ~                                    jr      nz,.CalcBlockXPosMulGrad
 669++CBC8 ~            .CalcBlockXPosDivGrad:  ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 670++CBC8 ~                                    push    bc
 671++CBC8 ~                                    ld      c,a
 672++CBC8 ~                                    ld      de,255
 673++CBC8 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 674++CBC8 ~                                    ld      h,l
 675++CBC8 ~                                    ld      l,0
 676++CBC8 ~                                    call    div_hl_c
 677++CBC8 ~                                    pop     bc
 678++CBC8 ~                                    jp      .DoneX2Calc
 679++CBC8 ~            ;                                 else set Adjust = X1 lo * Gradient
 680++CBC8 ~            .CalcBlockXPosMulGrad:  push    bc
 681++CBC8 ~                                    ld      a,(Gradient)            ;Q = gradient
 682++CBC8 ~                                    ld      de,255
 683++CBC8 ~                                    sub     hl,de
 684++CBC8 ~                                    call    HLeqyHLmulAdiv256       ; hl = YX = SR / Q
